author: wschwab
content: just checking my logic - this should mean that platforms using `tx.origin == msg.sender` could replace it (assuming proxies, otherwise a redeploy) with something like `require(EXTCODESIZE(tx.origin) == 0)`? (That's not valid Solidity, I know)

author: jochembrouwer
content:
You want to verify that the sender is the EOA so you have to check `tx.origin == msg.sender` and `EXTCODESIZE(tx.origin) == 0`. But yes the logic is correct the EXTCODESIZE will return 23 if an EOA is delegated here.
But in general you should not ban non-EOAs from interacting with a contract ðŸ™‚

author: _shemnon
content: If this is a recurring concern and pattern I wonder if we should adopt EIP-7880 EXTCODEADDRESS in legacy as well (it's currently targeted at EOF only). It will insulate code from the logic and also keep up if there are changes in the delegate format, such as to keep up with Address Space Expansion.
